definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: When Chou Chin heard Chin You-yu telling his sad story, he cried even harder.
sentences.chinese: 周进见姊夫说中他的心事，越发号啕大哭。

sentences.english: My three-year-old ha ba fit when I took his toy away.
sentences.chinese: 当我拿走他的玩具时，我三岁的孩子号啕大哭起来。

sentences.english: An old man sees a little boy sitting on a curb, crying.
sentences.chinese: 一位老人看见一个小男孩坐在路旁号啕大哭。

sentences.english: But now that he really had something to cry about, he stopped crying.
sentences.chinese: 如今他确实有事情要号啕大哭，他倒停止哭泣了。

sentences.english: Two seconds, you're bawling like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 两秒钟，你像个婴儿一样号啕大哭。

sentences.english: After a time, there arose a howl from the boy's room.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，从男孩的卧室里传出号啕大哭的声音。

sentences.english: A beautiful and sat down on the dirty floor bawler cement.
sentences.chinese: 张美丽坐在脏兮兮的水泥地板上号啕大哭。

sentences.english: She cried loudly because she lost her mobile phone.
sentences.chinese: 因为把手机丢了，她站在那里号啕大哭。

sentences.english: And, flinging herself down on the sagging sofa, she burst into wild crying.
sentences.chinese: 接着她就倒在破旧的沙发上，号啕大哭起来。

sentences.english: She began to howl when he walked out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 他一走出门，她就号啕大哭起来。

sentences.english: I went outside with it and cried my eyes out.
sentences.chinese: 我走出了房间，号啕大哭。

sentences.english: "There won't be a happy-ever-after, " she wailed over and over.
sentences.chinese: “那就再也不会快乐了，”她号啕大哭。

definition: to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
lit. cries of grief shake the heavens/great sorrow (idiom)
tears and mucus flowing profusely (idiom); weeping tragically
to cry out loud without tears
